findings.title: Business logic inconsistencies that may break the token balance after some trades
findings.description: The contract contains business logic inconsistencies that may break the token balance after some trades. The total supply is diverse from the address balances.

findings.title: Total supply diverse from address balances
findings.description: The contract sends more than the expected taxed amount to addresses without updating the total supply, resulting in a discrepancy between the total supply and address balances.

findings.title: BLC - Business Logic Concern
findings.description: The team is advised to carefully check if the implementation follows the expected business logic.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized to reduce size, memory consumption, and execution time.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: Code repetition detected in contract.sol at lines 806 and 1044.

findings.title: DSM - Data Structure Misuse
findings.description: The contract uses an array for _accounts which leads to unnecessary loops and increased gas requirements. It is recommended to use a data structure like Set that provides instant access.

findings.title: L01 - Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can be removed to optimize contract efficiency and reduce gas costs.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Variables defined in local scope have the same name as variables from an upper scope.
